title: Galaxy S21 Ultra Teardown! - Its bigger than you think....
description:
Its time to teardown the new Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra 5G. The fingerprint scanner is HUGE!! Grab your Teardown skin HERE: https://www.dbrand.com/teardown The Galaxy S21 Ultra is the latest and greatest from Samsung. And today we are going to see how the S21 Ultra works from the inside. Its not the normal periscope camera, and invincible battery adhesive. But there is one thing we haven't seen yet... and thats the MASSIVE fingerprint scanner. One perk of using an Ultrasonic Fingerprint scanner vs an optical fingerprint scanner is that the surface area can more easily be expanded. 

Watch the Periscope teardown HERE: https://youtu.be/k-OZVWcyN5w?t=292
Get my razor knife here! https://www.jerryrigknife.com/ 
Watch the S21 Durability Test HERE: https://youtu.be/Y4wrxLVs3eU

*Follow me for updates!*
Instagram: http://instagram.com/zacksjerryrig
Facebook: http://on.fb.me/1U4bQqv
Twitter: https://twitter.com/ZacksJerryRig

LARGE tool kit: http://amzn.to/2DURcr7
Travel Tool Kit: https://amzn.to/30LKXOY
Green Pry tool: http://amzn.to/1Tu57pI

The camera I used to film this video: http://amzn.to/2p7GtkX
The Lens I used for this video: http://amzn.to/1QOXDw2

And this Metabones adapter: http://amzn.to/2iZ67Ty
This is the drone I use: https://click.dji.com/AI2tmSb0onM9XPVwb-Se0g

TO SEND ME STUFF: See my P.O. Box on my 'About page': https://www.youtube.com/user/JerryRigEverything/about

Due to factors beyond the control of JerryRigEverything, no information contained in this video shall create any express or implied warranty or guarantee of any particular result.  Any injury, damage or loss that may result from improper use of these tools, equipment, or the information contained in this video is the sole responsibility of the user and not JerryRigEverything. Only attempt your own repairs if you can accept personal responsibility for the results, whether they are good or bad.
transcript: Hi. Today we're going to take apart the Galaxy S21 Ultra 5G. We'll get a good look at those cameras, and supposedly it's 77% larger underscreen fingerprint scanner. Should be interesting. Let's get started. [Intro] The S21 Ultra might have a slightly different contoured camera bump this time around, but the process to open her up is still basically the same as all the other Samsungs we've seen for the past 6 years - a lot of heat and gentle prying. My second batch of knives is all sold out by the way, but we will have a third batch coming in May or June if you want to preorder one of those and join the cool knife club. Jerryrigknife.com. The large camera bump actually makes the rear glass removal quite a bit easier, which is nice since the textured back makes it a little bit harder. My suction cup has a hard time gripping that rough surface. But eventually we do get the back panel off. The camera lens is metal, but the little circles inside the metal housing are glass and can be replaced if they ever break. Two of the camera protrusion sides are made from the sides of the phone that just extend upwards. The camera bump is still rather large compared to other phones, but I like this implementation. There are 14 normal Phillips head screws holding down the phone guts to the frame. I'll unplug the rear wireless charging coil, and the NFC pad right above that. Getting a closer look at the coils shows us that there are actually two coils of copper inside this pad. It could be that one of them is for the 15 watts of normal wireless charging, and the other is for the 4.5 watts of reverse wireless charging. I don't know enough about electromagnetic induction to say for certain though. I do know, however, that the battery connector can unsnap like a little Lego, along with the side buttons, rear LED flash, and earpiece speaker. The earpiece unit of the S21 Ultra is water resistant, with its own rubber gasket around the edge. Kind of cool. It sits inside of the frame next to the square vibrator. It's a bit a ways from the slit in the front phone. The speaker just channels its sound to that slit through the gap in between the phone frame and the screen. It's a little tunnel of tones, if you will. I'll unplug the front facing camera, along with a few other ribbons, and the super long extensions that go between the main board and the charging port. This phone is one of the international S21 Ultra variants, which means that the millimeter wave antennas are missing from the sides, even though it does still say 5G on the box. It's another one of Samsung's weird advertising quirks, alongside their Exynos and Qualcomm performance differences. And by quirks, I mean it's a stretch to even consider the international and domestic variants to be the same product. The camera units take up a huge portion of real estate inside of the phone with 4 lenses and massive internal sensors. The cameras are one of the main selling points of this new phone. Up top we have the 12 megapixel ultra wide, which does not have OIS. The 108 megapixel main camera does have OIS, along with the 10 megapixel 3x telephoto zoom which also has OIS. The periscope camera has the OIS internally. I did take the periscope portion apart in last year's S20 Ultra video. I'll link that down in the description. It's pretty cool to see. We have some graphite behind the cameras, under the motherboard, and against the screen to help with the heat dissipation. The top front facing 40 megapixel camera is actually glued into the frame...very securely, might I add. Trying to remove it actually ripped the sensor from the back side of the camera, which means it's probably toast, but we'll find out for sure when I put it all back together. I'll pop off the bottom plastics. This is where the second stereo speaker is located. This guy does have the sound dampening foam balls inside. The bottom board does have three screws of its own holding it in place, along with a singular SIM card slot. This slot does not have any expandable memory, but the USB-C does have a similar IP68 red rubber ring, just like we saw around the top earpiece. In order for us to find that new ultrasonic fingerprint scanner, we have to remove the battery, which unfortunately for us is a Samsung battery. The glue holding this thing together will outlast the entire universe. Even with isopropyl alcohol to dissolve the adhesive and heat, it's still a doozy to remove. It's pretty crazy, but eventually doable. Dogs are allowed this time, if you know what I mean. Now, the ultrasonic fingerprint scanner is easy to spot at this point and it is huge. It has the largest footprint of any fingerprint scanner we've ever seen. It's so big you might even be able to use your footprint. We'll do a little side by side size comparison between this ultrasonic and last year's 20 ultrasonic scanner. Not only is this one much larger, but there's also less empty space around the scanner itself. Jumping 77 in size in just two years is a big improvement. MKBHD's dream of seeing a fingerprint scanner that covers half the phone could be a reality within the next year or two. Overall, I'm going to say that the S21 Ultra didn't do anything crazy, unique, or new this year, it's just the same consistent Samsung experience that we've gotten for years, with it's incremental improvements. And even though this particular phone might not be calling my name, I'm sure it will get the job done for anyone who does get one. I'll get the wireless charging coils back into place so we can check the front facing camera that I decapitated. The phone still turns on, so I'll get the back glass situated. The rear camera looks to be working fine, but as soon as I turn it to the front camera it fritzes out and doesn't want to display any images, which I don't blame him. I wouldn't really want to work if someone ripped me in half either. Accidents happen, which is why if you want to see your phone from the inside, it's a whole lot safer just to get one of my Teardown Skins. All of the beautiful internals without any of the decapitations. I'll leave a link for my Teardown Skin down in the video description. Let me know what you think of the S21 Ultra down in the comments...I'm curious. Hit that subscribe button if you haven't already. Come hang out with me on Instagram and Twitter. And thanks a ton for watching. I'll see you around.
